DOC.HEAD: Firefighters Work to Contain Fire at Oil Plant
With AM-Refinery Explosion
DOC.TEXT: A fire in an oil company warehouse triggered a night-long series of explosions that shot fireballs as high as 150 feet in the air, officials said Tuesday. The fire at Troco Oil Co., which began Monday night, was under control by early Tuesday afternoon, officials said. Troco officials did not return telephone calls seeking comment, but Fire Department spokesman Jim White said the company's owner had been notified of the fire. A juvenile detention center and a shelter across from Troco were evacuated without incident. The only injury reported was to a firefighter whose eyes were irritated with foam. He was treated at a hospital and released. Firefighters used water unsuccessfully on the fire for about 1{ hours until a Sun Co. foam truck arrived to help smother it, White said. Sun Co. operates a nearby refinery. Troco ``blends oils for special applications. Everything in there is oil or some type of lubricant,'' White said. ``We thought we had it with this foam, but we had trouble getting to the seat of the fire,'' White said. ``About 1:30 or 2 a.m., we knew we were not doing any good. The oil was fueling the fire and we started having explosion after explosion, with flames 150 feet in the air.'' White said firefighters will spend the next couple of days spraying hot spots at the plant, and it will be several days before an inspection can be made to determine the cause of the fire.
